stepByStepInstructions:
Attach the handle to the top of the cable machine.
Stand in front of the tower and grab the handle about shoulder-width apart.
Take a small step back and, if needed, pull the handle down slightly.
Lean your upper body forward a bit and gently arch your back. This is the starting position.
With your arms extended, pull the handle down towards your hips.
Hold this position briefly before returning to the starting position in a controlled motion.
commonMistake: Avoid using momentum to perform the exercise. Swinging your upper body and arms will move the weight, but it reduces the training effect on your lats and stabilizing muscles. Instead, it puts more strain on your tendons and joints, which can lead to injuries.
citation: Training.fit, "Straight Arm Pulldown - Instructions, Information & Alternatives," Training.fit. [Online]. Available: https://training.fit/exercise/straight-arm-pulldown/.
